ygData.subject: Re: Stein
ygData.msgSnippet: People keep saying that enchanters are the only ones who can do the quest and it s just not true.  I completed the quest days before I even thought about that
ygData.messageBody:
People keep saying that enchanters are the only ones
who can do the quest and it's just not true. I
completed the quest days before I even thought about
that an enchanter could do it too. All it requires is
2 people one of whom is an Ogre. The factions
required are not all that hard to obtain if you know
what you are doing. We did it in one evening without
too much trouble.

The reason enchanters should do the quest for cash is
because, if they don't, someone else will and you guys
won't get any of the profits being generated. Bah,
listening to how cliqueish some of you sound, I guess
it's just as well. MOST of the people I know who have
done the quest are not enchanters. The two who are
both just powerleveled an enchanter up to 12 and did
the quest. I'd just laugh at an enchanter who wanted
hundreds of plat to do the quest. It just ain't that
hard. Don't worry, I imagine they'll nerf it soon.

--- Tim Borelli <timb@...> wrote:
> From: Tim Borelli <timb@...>
>
> i dont see going to get someone a stein a kindness.
> it's a service, one
> they cant perform, ever. they need us. watch what
> happens if someone asks
> you to do it for them, and you say no. more often
> than not, when i was
> asked and i said no, i was given rude remarks, as
> though it's my DUTY to go
> get someone a stein. sorry, i dont want to waste my
> time fetching items for
> people, it's not why i play the game...
>
> a kindness would be giving someone food, or doing
> something else for them
> that they can normally do, but are under a
> circumstance where they cannot
> for now.
>
> just MHO.
>
> Qorona Mindbender of the Volition Guild, 28th lvl
> enchanter on Cazic-Thule
> Qoronita, 9th level Erudite Enchantress on
> Cazic-Thule
> (let's see who reaches 30 first, heh)
>
> >
> >I have never charged anyone for a kindness. I
> think charging to help
> someone
> >is wrong. But then...we all have our views.
> >
> >Kasondra
